results.doc_title: VMS OTP UAT - Part 2 - 2025/12/30 09:27 EST - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Re-review One-Time Purchase (OTP) scenarios and test cases, monitor events generated on staging, and address bug findings from previous UAT sessions

decisions.what: Prioritize four high-priority tickets for resolution before deployment
decisions.context: Including contradictory price communication, subscription discount communication, dashboard bundles section issue, and shipping fee discrepancy

decisions.what: Katana issue must be solved before deployment to live
decisions.context: Event rollout issues preventing live deployment

decisions.what: Extend dashboard bundles logic to show OTP/subscription selection modal similar to credit page
decisions.context: Current dashboard bundles section only affects subscription orders, needs to support OTP orders

decisions.what: Test order creation on both live and staging environments to verify event generation
decisions.context: Confirming events are triggered and received by Katana and Salesforce

action_items.task: Open support ticket with Katana group in Slack regarding event rollout issues
Find alternative contact for SFMC (Salesforce) issue since Christian hasn't responded
Create message to Katana support thread, ping Pablo and Brad
Create tickets for identified bugs and share links with team
Work with Emily on high and medium priority issues
Provide update on progress for medium and high priority issues
Provide update on release timing and Katana issue resolution

action_items.timeline: Next week (delayed due to incident and capacity limitations)

key_points: High-priority bugs from previous findings have been addressed
Testing events generated on staging using platform that listens to CFKA topics
Event confirmation process: order completion triggers Kafka topic event, which should be received by Katana and Salesforce
Shipping fee discrepancy identified for OTP orders
Dashboard bundles section needs refactoring to support OTP order selection
Price reflection issues when changing item frequency or quantity
Team is close to finishing OTP feature and preparing for release

blockers.issue: Katana event rollout - no message received for first issue
blockers.impact: Cannot deploy to live until resolved
Need alternative contact to resolve event-related issues
Payments team working on incident, limited capacity, fix delayed to next week

blockers.issue: Dashboard bundles section breaking - critical priority
blockers.impact: Users cannot properly add items as OTP or subscription orders from dashboard

blockers.issue: Price not reflecting correctly when changing item frequency or quantity

follow_ups: Confirm Katana and other systems receive event data from live orders
Monitor progress on four high-priority tickets
Determine release date once Katana issue is resolved
Continue UAT testing for remaining OTP scenarios

results.meeting_purpose: Technical spike to analyze and plan the precheckout meal selection feature for Factor US customers coming from HelloFresh US through the crossbrands passwordless signup experience

decisions.what: Backend-based CRS solution is not recommended despite being readily available
decisions.context: The NVB team's solution is temporary and will be sunsetted in favor of Cart Foundation Squad's solution. It was built specifically for Goodchop's static menu and is enmeshed with recurring selection service

decisions.what: Frontend precheckout meal selection will repurpose the Goodchop frontend solution
decisions.context: To reduce development effort and reuse existing functionality

decisions.what: Special routing rules for existing Factor customers
decisions.context: Deactivated Factor customers route to Reactivations page; logged-in Factor customers route to My Deliveries page

action_items.task: Build crossbrands passwordless signup experience for HelloFresh US customers checking out through Factor US signup funnel
Verify effort estimate with NVB team for CRS solution
Investigate Cart Foundation Squad endpoint availability and workarounds
Account for filterDeliveryMoments/firstDeliveryDate RCS setting for demand steering

key_points: HelloFresh US customers will use magic link authentication to sign up for Factor US
Users will select meals in the new Factor signup funnel before subscription creation, which will be patched later
Two backend solution options exist: Customer Recurring Selection Service (CRS) and Cart Foundation Squad endpoint
CRS solution was previously implemented for Goodchop brand with static weekly menus
Cart Foundation Squad has a yearly planning agreement to provide an endpoint for multiple brands
Effort estimate for CRS solution is approximately 1 sprint with 1 FTE (including Progress Bar changes)
The solution needs to handle users selecting from public menu only
Challenge exists with users potentially changing their first delivery week and invalidating selections
blockers: Team is blocked until Cart Foundation Squad endpoint becomes available or CRS is updated to handle multiple countries
CRS needs to be disintegrated as precheckout meal selection and recurring meal selection for Goodchop
Solution doesn't currently account for filterDeliveryMoments/firstDeliveryDate RCS setting used for demand steering on Factor US
Users changing first delivery week before checkout would invalidate their meal selections
Uncertainty about whether existing solution is responsive and impacts Single Question Flow
follow_ups: Clarify if workarounds exist for Cart Foundation endpoint or if team is completely blocked
Determine if demand steering settings will cause potential issues
Confirm whether Single Question Flow needs updates or if progress bar changes are sufficient
Validate effort estimate of 1.5 sprints after developer investigation
Understand why GoodChop team moved away from Cart Foundation solution to use CRS
Clarify if solution will duplicate or modify existing GoodChop implementation
Determine if header/progress bar updates are needed for SingleQuestionFlow

results.doc_title: Q1 Planning Workshop - 2025/12/04 14:56 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Bottom-up planning exercise at tribe level for Q1 2025 to prioritize initiatives, flag risks, identify cross-team support needs, and assess priority and confidence levels for deliverables
attendees: Fernando Luiz Valente de Souza Wellney

decisions.what: Deliverable deadline extended to Tuesday instead of sharing tomorrow
decisions.context: Original plan was to share by tomorrow, but adjusted because someone will be on a plane

decisions.what: Monthly granularity for deliverables planning instead of quarterly
decisions.context: Discussed during session to provide more detailed planning structure

decisions.what: Need to create standardized template for planning
decisions.context: Granularity was inconsistent across teams, need to standardize format

action_items.task: Create template for monthly deliverables with standardized granularity
Update yearly plan with top highlighted items and changes from bottom-up exercises
action_items.timeline: By Tuesday for Essential Functions meeting

action_items.task: Share template and instructions with teams
Address KTLO (Keep The Lights On) assumptions confidence for each team

key_points: Session is a new bottom-up planning process at tribe level, not for discussing minuscule details
Shift to React Native is underway
Appio deprecation is planned
Multi-region readiness for Project 500 is high priority
Snowplow implementation for personalization signals needs prioritization
Scalable food profile architecture requires further scoping
Seamless downgrade issue is highest priority for merchandising team
This is an 'exotic quarter' because normally would have started with meta backlog
Need to sync top-down and bottom-up planning approaches
Interactive color-coded sheet used to assess priority and confidence levels

blockers.issue: Snowplow implementation lacks ownership despite being a blocker for meta backlog items
Seamless downgrade issue needs long-term solution
Scalable food profile architecture needs scoping and dependency management
KTLO assumptions confidence not captured in current exercise

follow_ups: Discuss personalization exception with Leo Lee
Sync top-down and bottom-up planning after meta backlog finalization
Essential Functions meeting on Tuesday to review updated plan
Address how to capture KTLO confidence assumptions
Review and improve planning process for next iteration

entities.name: React Native
entities.context: Technology shift underway as part of Q1 initiatives

entities.name: Appio
entities.context: System being deprecated

entities.name: Project 500
entities.context: Multi-region readiness is high priority deliverable

entities.name: Snowplow
entities.context: Implementation needed for personalization signals, currently lacks ownership

entities.name: Fernando
entities.context: Absent from meeting, Leo Lee covering for foundations material

entities.name: meta backlog
entities.context: Top-down planning artifact that normally would start the process, being synced with bottom-up planning

entities.name: Hello Tech Essential Functions meeting
entities.context: Tuesday meeting where updated plan will be shared
